subject: PEL: Update bmc & platform dump status in SRC section
commitMessage:
PEL: Update bmc & platform dump status in SRC section

With every PEL creation, the status of bmc and platform dumps -
Hardware and Hypervisor would be checked and status bits in SRC
section updated accordingly.

Change-Id: I3ec7626611cf330f2ce235a97ee3046c0d32b6ab
Signed-off-by: Sumit Kumar <sumit_kumar@in.ibm.com>

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 9d43a7277ab2ff069c10f87216c067ae1dbca5ee by Matt Spinler
you may as well return here so it doesn't read more dbus properties than it needs to

This is what I was ref to ask earlier.
say we have following entries and we go traversing in sequence:
/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/bmc/entry/1
/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/bmc/entry/2

Then reading from any of the path above that could give us the dump status is good enough and we need not to further traverse as other paths may also be showing of the same dump status??
correct

yea, you can just use a for loop:
for (const auto& [path, serviceInfo] : subtree)
since this function will throw if there are no dumps, you can just catch the exception here and say there aren't any.
Ok
The src testcase should have a good spot to check these values
Ok
why do you need to test for Offloaded? method just says status of dump.. may be some comment on logic would help
how about 'type' here instead.  'resource' can't really be considered a platform.
Ok yeah sound reasonable
can remove this TODO now.
Done
nit:typo
Done
better to remove this.  Not having dumps is a good thing, so we don't want  to print warnings in that case.
yeah ok. How about get rid of this exception itself as in next patch. Let me know what you think?
maybe use 'offloaded' here, or at least 'o'.  's' sounds like Status, but Status is 't' ;)  and same for t.
Done

You mean dbus call itself can throw exception as-in my earlier patch I was throwing exception when subtree returned was empty?? 
Does function checkDumpStatus() in latest patch looks fine (I have removed throwing exception)?
right, _bus.call(method) can throw.  also the getProperty calls.
Done
when you've been testing this with no resource or systems dumps, does the code throw an exception at all?

No exception was reported. The GetSubTree in this case, look for 'any' dump entry interface available on DBus 'irrespective' of dump type. If found, it would do further processing of finding out dump type next and applying getProperty on it. If no dump entry interface found it just returns. I checked dump behaviour as follows:
- system having no dump entry at all
- system having atleast one dump entry of requested type (bmc)
- system having atleast one dump (Hostboot) entry but not of requested type (bmc,resource,system)
In all above cases, no exception and pel was created successfully.

In the process found a bug as well :)
System having Hostboot dump entries alone, set the bmc dump bit in SRC as "bmc" name was appearing in the hostboot object path:
/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/hostboot/entry/1
Its fixed in next patch.

so sorry for missing this before, but these three calls are making 3 of the exact same GetSubTree calls.  I would like to avoid that so we make the minimum number of d-bus calls possible.  I think you could simplify the code to have 

std::tuple<bool, bool, bool> DataInterface::getDumpStatus()

and it hardcodes the dump types within the function and does one GetSubTree and returns the results, so you could do like:

auto [hasBmcDump, hasHostbootDump, hasResourceDump] = dataIface.getDumpStatus();

Yes its 3 calls - one per dump type. Actually when I started writing this code I planned to do it everything inside data interface function itself but then decided against it bcoz of following:
- making function complex
- to clearly separate out the params between src and data interface files
- make data interface function independent & seamless from adding of new dump types as needed

Now as you have mentioned, will modify it in a bit diff way that could still meet above points.
this should be <iterator>  (if you truly need it?)
Ok
i would have been OK with you hardcoding the dump types in this function if you wanted.
Actually I didn't wanted to hardcode stuffs here and tried to make this function seamless to absorb any new dump type if any, added in future.
Yeah this would be nice. Thanks for pointing out.
Ok
Yeah ok
this isn't really needed
This is the case when dump status bit of particular dump type is already updated from a object path available. Do we really need to traverse remaining paths of same dump type still?
oh sorry, I was just referring to the '== true' part.
oh yeah sorry, understood now.
I can't quite figure out the reason you need this check?

This is the case in continuation of comment in line no. 666. If the dump status bits of all dump types are already updated, do we still continue with remaining available paths? Take for instance:
root@rain135c:~# busctl tree xyz.openbmc_project.Dump.Manager
└─/xyz
  └─/xyz/openbmc_project
    └─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump
      ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/bmc
      │ └─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/bmc/entry
      │   ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/bmc/entry/10
      │   ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/bmc/entry/11
      │   ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/bmc/entry/12
      ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/hardware
      ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/hostboot
      │ └─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/hostboot/entry
      │   ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/hostboot/entry/1
      │   ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/hostboot/entry/2
      │   ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/hostboot/entry/3
      ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/internal
      │ └─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/internal/manager
      ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/resource
      │   ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/resource/entry/20
      │   ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/resource/entry/21
      │   ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/resource/entry/22
      └─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/system
      │   ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/system/entry/30
      │   ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/system/entry/31
      │   ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/system/entry/32
      │   ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/system/entry/33
      │   ├─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/system/entry/34

with above, dump status bit of types of bmc,resource & system will already be updated with paths:
├─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/bmc/entry/10
├─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/resource/entry/20
├─/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/system/entry/30
